snippet: Missouri must recognize marriages of same-sex couples legally performed in other states, a state judge ruled Friday.
abstract: Circuit Judge J Dale Youngs of Jackson County rules that Missouri must recognize marriages of same-sex couples legally performed in other states; decision allows such couples to become eligible for range of benefits.
lead_paragraph: Missouri must recognize marriages of same-sex couples legally performed in other states, a state judge ruled Friday.

headline.main: Missouri: Court Rules for Same-Sex Couples
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Court Rules for Same-Sex Couples

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
